meanings.definition: To attract or pull towards oneself, as if by a magnetic force.
meanings.sent1: The shiny new toy was so magnetizing that all the kids wanted to play with it.
meanings.sent2: The strong magnet was magnetizing the metal paperclips on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies was magnetizing, drawing everyone to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was magnetizing, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting were magnetizing, capturing the attention of all who passed by.

meanings.definition: To make something magnetic or capable of being attracted by a magnet.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was magnetizing the iron rod to conduct his experiment.
meanings.sent2: The process of magnetizing the metal bar involved exposing it to a strong magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could magnetize any object with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's enthusiasm for science was magnetizing, making even the most disinterested students curious.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers were magnetizing, allowing him to attract objects from a distance.
